title: It's obvious why support's "boring"
body:
- People complain when the LCS has too much turtling.

- Riot themselves stated they wanted players fighting *more* and *sooner*.

- Even the players themselves say champs like Sona and Janna are some of the most easy, brain-dead, boring champs in the game.

And yet we actively push the opposite of what people want into the support role. Now we can't figure out why it's boring?

replies.body: Don't play like a passive ward-vendor and it won't be boring.

Everything about the game and the community reinforces the notion to play THAT EXACT WAY though.

Picked Brand/Zyra? "You're not a support. You're a 'support'".

Building support items? All the strongest items are defensive. Hell, almost all the items, period, are defensive.

Say anything about it? Get downvote bombed and told to build mid laner items.

But hey, I'm still a support main. I'm addressing why others are few and far in between.

you don't even understand what you are talking about

sona is a very aggressive support who deals a ton of damage and has lichbane and ap stuff as her meta core

1) Building *mid laner items* doesn't address *support-designated itemization*. That's a band-aid to a long-standing problem.

2) More often than not I'm seeing more enchanter supports going with the Redemption/Locket core. This includes Sona players.

3) Your post doesn't address anything except the notion that Sona players could be building ap items sometimes?

4) Her play pattern is still 1 note.

And addressing the rest of this:

- If the case is that there shouldn't be many role-specific items, why are people afraid of support items being used in other lanes to the point where we stifle what stats we put on them?

- Just because Sona players build Lich because there's a lack of better, more cost efficient support items that suit her play style doesn't mean support itemization is friendly towards more aggressive champs. It isn't.

- TF's play pattern isn't as 1-note as Sona's. Sona is nearly nothing but mashing auto-aimed moves and auras. TF has a semi-global teleport and a skill shot in his basic kit to flesh out his difficulty curve.

- Even if you mention *just* Sona, who isn't even played that often anyway, that doesn't address anyone outside of her who's been turned into a shield bot, which still includes her to a decent degree anyway.
